title: How to Send an Email Using Gmail

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. Go to https://www.gmail.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open your Gmail inbox if you're logged in . If you aren't logged into your Gmail account, enter your email address and password when prompted.

steps.title: Click ＋ Compose.
steps.content: Click ＋ Compose . It's in the upper-left side of your Gmail inbox. Doing so opens a "New Message" window in the lower-right corner of the page. [1] X Research source If you're using the old version of Gmail, you'll click COMPOSE here instead.

steps.title: Enter the other person's email address.
steps.content: Enter the other person's email address. Click the "To" or "Recipients" text box at the top of the New Message window, then type in the email address of the person to whom you want to send your email. [2] X Research source To add multiple email addresses , type in the first email address, press Tab ↹ , and repeat with the other email addresses. If you want to CC or BCC someone on the email, click either the Cc link or the Bcc link in the far-right side of the "To" text field, then type the email address you want to CC or BCC into the "Cc" or "Bcc" text field, respectively.

steps.title: Add a subject.
steps.content: Add a subject. Click the "Subject" text field, then type in whatever you want the subject of the email to be. [3] X Research source Typically speaking, an email subject describes the gist of the email's message in a few words.

steps.title: Enter your email message.
steps.content: Enter your email message. In the large text box below the "Subject" text box, type in whatever you want for your email message. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Format
steps.content: Format your email's text if needed. If you want to apply formatting to your text (e.g., bolding, italics, or bullet points), highlight the text to which you want to apply the formatting, then click one of the formatting options at the bottom of the email window. [5] X Research source For example, to bold a section of text, you would highlight the text and then click B at the bottom of the email.

steps.title: Attach
steps.content: Attach a file if you like. To add a file from your computer, click the "Attachments" icon at the bottom of the window, then select the file(s) you want to upload and click Open (or Choose on a Mac). [6] X Research source You can add photos in this way, or you can upload photos directly to the email's body by clicking the "Photos" icon at the bottom of the window, clicking Upload , clicking Choose photos to upload , and selecting photos as needed.

steps.title: Click Send.
steps.content: Click Send . It's a blue button in the bottom-left corner of the email window. Doing so will send your email to the specified email address(es). [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. Tap the Gmail app icon, which resembles a multicolored "M" on a white background. This will open your Gmail inbox if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, select your account and/or enter your email address and password to log in.

steps.title: Tap the "Compose" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Compose" icon. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so brings up a new message window. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Enter an email address.
steps.content: Enter an email address. Tap the "To" text box, then type in the email address of the person to whom you want to send an email. [9] X Research source If you want to CC or BCC anyone on the email, tap on the far-right side of the "To" text box, tap either Cc or Bcc , and type in the email address you want to use.

steps.title: Enter a subject.
steps.content: Enter a subject. Tap the "Subject" text box, then enter the subject you want to use. [10] X Research source Generally, a subject summarizes the email in a few words.

steps.title: Enter your email's message.
steps.content: Enter your email's message. Tap the "Compose email" text box, then type in whatever you want to use for your email. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Add files or photos if necessary.
steps.content: Add files or photos if necessary. If you want to place a file or photo in your email, do the following: [12] X Research source Tap at the top of the screen. Tap Camera roll (iPhone) or Attach file (Android). Select the photo or file you want to use.

steps.title: Tap the "Send" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Send" icon. It's a paper plane-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen. Your email will be sent. [13] X Research source
